subject: Physical Fitness
title: Agonists and Antagonists
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Agonists and Antagonists.

hook.text: Bend your elbow and your bicep contracts. But something else has to let go. That's your tricep.

buildup.text: The agonist is the muscle doing the work. The antagonist is its opposite, relaxing to allow movement.

discovery.text: Every major muscle has an antagonist pair. Quads vs hamstrings. Chest vs back. Push vs pull.

twist.text: Imbalanced pairs cause injury. Weak hamstrings with strong quads are a recipe for knee problems.

climax.text: Smart training works both sides of every pair. Balanced muscles move better and hurt less.

punchline.text: Every muscle has a partner. Train both or pay the price.

quiz.question: What happens when agonist-antagonist pairs are imbalanced?
options: The weaker muscle catches up on its own
